basic.description: An evolutionary approach to the study of animal behaviour. This course explores processes and patterns in behaviour, with emphasis on perception, communication, foraging, spacing, reproduction and social behaviour in a variety of animals. Methods of studying and analyzing behaviour are explored through laboratory exercises.
basic.subject: BIOL
basic.title: Animal Behaviour

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Recommendation    BIOL202.
Corequisite     6.0 units in BIOL at the 200 level.
